description: A case applies a precedent in a different manner or interprets it differently without rejecting it

difference_description.description: How the application differs from original or typical interpretation

original_context.description: Original context in which precedent was applied

original_context.name: new_context
original_context.description: New context in which precedent is being applied

interpretive_approach.description: Approach: literal, liberal, purposive, restrictive, expansive

consistency.description: Whether different application is consistent with precedent: yes, no, partial

legal_principle_affected.description: Legal principles affected by different application

impact.description: Impact of different application: clarifying, confusing, limiting, expanding

acceptance.description: Whether different application was accepted by later cases

indexes: CREATE INDEX applied_differently_type IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:APPLIED_DIFFERENTLY]-() ON (r.difference_type)
CREATE INDEX applied_differently_consistency IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:APPLIED_DIFFERENTLY]-() ON (r.consistency)
CREATE INDEX applied_differently_impact IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:APPLIED_DIFFERENTLY]-() ON (r.impact)
usage_examples:
// Find all different applications of a precedent
MATCH (precedent:Case {case_id: 'case_bd_sc_2015_456'})<-[a:APPLIED_DIFFERENTLY]-(applying:Case)
RETURN applying.citation, a.difference_type, a.difference_description, a.consistency
ORDER BY applying.decision_date

// Find inconsistent applications
MATCH (precedent:Case)<-[a:APPLIED_DIFFERENTLY]-(applying:Case)
WHERE a.consistency IN ['no', 'partial']
  AND precedent.primary_domain = 'Constitutional'
RETURN precedent.citation, applying.citation, a.difference_description, a.impact
